document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 171–172. Austroscaeva melanostoma (Macquart, 1842): (171) visiting Euryops pectinatus (L.) Cass, Santiago (photo by Gabriela Germain), and (172) Austroscaeva occidentalis (Shannon, 1927) visiting a flower of Orizoë sp., Ocoa (photo by Daniel Llavaneras).

World distribution. Argentina , Ecuador , Peru and Chile .
Chilean distribution. From Arica y Parinacota to Magallanes region ( Fig. 175 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to highland ecosystems (40– 4,550 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes.
Austroscaeva melanostoma
is a species with a wide distribution, associated with several native plant species.
Múñoz & Arroyo (2004)
,
Múñoz et al. (2005)
and
Múñoz & Arroyo (2006)
recorded this species visiting
Chuquiraga oppositifolia D. Don
, while Torres-Díaz et al. , (2011) associated it with
Chaetanthera renifolia (J. Remy) Cabrera. Porter (1921)
mentioned that professor Stuardo collected
A. melanostoma
visiting
A. chilensis
in La Serena. Exotic plant species
T. officinale
is also visited by this fly ( Múñoz & Cavieres 2008 ). On the other hand, many Andes plant species are visited by
A. melanostoma
such as
Nothoscordum andinum (Poepp.) Kunth
ex. Fuentes,
Chaetanthera euphrasioides (DC) Meigen
and
Draba gilliesi
H. & A. (
Arroyo et al. 1982
). This flower fly species has also been observed visiting flowers of
Buddleja suaveolens Kunth & Bouché
(Rodrigo Barahona-Segovia, pers. obs.);
Chrysanthemum
sp. (Gabriela Germain, CSP record);
Huidrobia fruticosa Phil.
(Juan Contreras, CSP record);
Junglans regia
L. (Ariadna Veas, CSP record);
Lithraea caustica (Molina) Hook. et Arn
(Beatriz Macuer, CSP record);
Loasa placei Lindl.
(Orlando Montes, CSP record);
Loasa triloba Dombey Ex Juss.
(Rodrigo Barahona-Segovia pers. obs.);
Osteospermum
sp. (Fernanda Gatalina, CSP record);
Senecio erucifolius
L. (Orlando Montes, CSP record) and
Tropaeolum jilesii Sparre
(Anita Flores , CSP record).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 986,983 km 2 , AOO = 292 km 2 , 63 subpopulations and 64 localities.
